meanings.definition: A sudden strong feeling of excitement or fear
meanings.sent1: The unexpected roller coaster drop gave me a frisson of excitement.
meanings.sent2: She felt a frisson of fear when she heard a loud noise in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie was so intense that it caused a frisson of fear in the audience.
meanings.sent4: As the final goal was scored, a frisson of excitement swept through the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house tour promised a frisson of fear at every turn.
